project.name: SpringRoll
project.description: An application framework for building HTML5 Canvas games and applications

springroll.Application.name: springroll.Application
springroll.Application.description:
Application is the main entry point for using SpringRoll, creating
an application allows the creation of displays and adding of module
functionality (e.g. sound, captions, etc). All timing and asynchronous
events should be handled by the Application to control the play
and pause. Any update, Ticker-type functions, should use the Applications
update event.

	var app = new Application();

params.name: options
params.description:
The options for creating the application,
		see `springroll.ApplicationOptions` for the specific options
		that can be overridden and set.

params.name: init
params.description: The callback when initialized

springroll.UserData.name: springroll.UserData
springroll.UserData.description:
This class is responsible for saving the user-specific data
within an Application. This can be player-progress data, high
score information, or other data that needs be saved between
sessions of running an app.

params.name: container
params.description: The container instance

springroll.CombinedCallback.name: springroll.CombinedCallback
springroll.CombinedCallback.description:
CombinedCallback is a utility class that creates a function to be passed to multiple
asynchronous functions as a callback, and will call your callback on the last time it
is called.

props.name: autoDestroy

props.name: useFrames

If the DelayedCall should use frames instead of
                                milliseconds for the delay.

springroll.Enum.name: springroll.Enum
springroll.Enum.description:
An enumeration, similar to Enums in C#. Each value is created as an EnumValue on the Enum,
referenced as a property with the same name as the EnumValue. Examples:

		var myEnum = new springroll.Enum(
			"valueOf0",
			"valueOf1",
			"valueOf2");
		var myOtherEnum = new springroll.Enum(
			{name: "one", value:"1", toString:"I am the One!"},
			"two",
			{name:"screwSequentialNumbers", value:42});
			
		myEnum.valueOf0 != 0;//enum values are not integers
		myEnum.valueOf1 != myOtherEnum.one;//enum values are not the same as other enums
		myEnum.valueOf2.asInt == 2;//enum values can be explicitly compared to integers
		myOtherEnum.screwSequentialNumbers == myOtherEnum.valueFromInt(42);//can use ints to get values
		console.log(myOtherEnum.one.toString());//outputs "I am the One!"

		for (var i in myEnum) console.log(i); //outputs "valueOf0","valueOf1","valueOf2"

params.name:
arguments
The
params.description:
list of enumeration values. You can pass either an
array or a list of parameters. Each string will be
the previous value plus one, while objects with
'name' and 'value' properties will have the specified
numeric value.

springroll.WeightedRandom.name: springroll.WeightedRandom
springroll.WeightedRandom.description:
A class for generating weighted random values. Input objects are dictionary objects
where the keys are the strings to be picked from, and the values are the corresponding
odds as integers. For example:

 {
     itemWith25PercentChance: 2,
     itemWith50PercentChance: 4,
     otherItemWith25PercentChance: 2
 }

params.name: object
params.description: The configuration object for this weighted value generator.

springroll.easeljs.BitmapMovieClip.name: springroll.easeljs.BitmapMovieClip
springroll.easeljs.BitmapMovieClip.description:
A class similar to createjs.MovieClip, but made to play animations from a
springroll.easeljs.TextureAtlas. The EaselJS Sprite class requires a spritesheet with equal
sized and spaced frames. By using TextureAtlas, you can use a much smaller spritesheet,
sprites on screen with fewer extra transparent pixels, and use the same API as MovieClip.

Format for BitmapMovieClip data:

	{
		fps:30,
		labels:
		{
			animStart:0,
			animStart_loop:15
		},
		origin:{ x: 20, y:30 },
		frames:
		[
			{
				name:"myAnim#",
				min:1,
				max:20,
				digits:4
			}
		],
		scale:1
	}

The example object describes a 30 fps animation that is 20 frames long, and was originally
myAnim0001.png->myAnim0020.png, with frame labels on the first and 16th frames. 'digits' is
optional, and defaults to 4.

params.name: atlas
params.description: The texture atlas to pull frames from.

params.name: data
params.description: Initialization data

props.name: fps
props.description:
Framerate to play the movieclip at. Omitting this will use the
                     current framerate.

props.name: labels
props.description:
A dictionary of the labels in the movieclip to assist in
                           playing animations.

props.name: origin
props.description: The origin of the movieclip.

props.name: frames
props.description: An array of frame sequences to pull from the texture atlas.

props.name: name
props.description:
The name to use for the frame sequence. This should
                                include a "#" to be replaced with the image number.

props.name: min
props.description: The first frame number in the frame sequence.

props.name: max
props.description: The last frame number in the frame sequence.

props.name: digits
props.description:
The maximum number of digits in the names of the frames,
                                 e.g. myAnim0001 has 4 digits.

props.name: scale
props.description:
The scale at which the art was exported, e.g. a scale of 1.4
                            means the art was increased in size to 140% before exporting
                            and should be scaled back down before drawing to the screen.

springroll.easeljs.Button.name: springroll.easeljs.Button
springroll.easeljs.Button.description:
A Multipurpose button class. It is designed to have one image, and an optional text label.
The button can be a normal button or a selectable button.
The button functions similarly with both EaselJS and PIXI, but slightly differently in
initialization and callbacks. Add event listeners for click and mouseover to know about
button clicks and mouse overs, respectively.

params.name: imageSettings
params.description:
Information about the art to be used
                                                    for button states, as well as if the
                                                    button is selectable or not. If this
                                                    is an Image or Canvas element, then
                                                    the button assumes that the image is
                                                    full width and 3 images tall, in the
                                                    order (top to bottom) up, over, down.
                                                    If so, then the properties of
                                                    imageSettings are ignored.

props.name: image
props.description:
The image to use for all of the button
                                                   states.

props.name: priority
props.description: The state priority order. If omitted, defaults to ["disabled", "down", "over", "up"]. Previous versions of Button used a hard coded order: ["highlighted", "disabled", "down", "over", "selected", "up"].

props.name: up
props.description: The visual information about the up state.

props.name: src
props.description:
The sourceRect for the state within the
                                               image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x &
                                                     y are how many pixels were trimmed
                                                     off the left and right, and height &
                                                     width are the untrimmed size of the
                                                     button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state.
                                          Properties on this parameter override data in
                                          the label parameter for this button state only.
                                          All values except "text" from the label
                                          parameter may be overridden.

props.name: over
props.description:
The visual information about the over state. If
                                      omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description:
The sourceRect for the state within the
                                                 image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x
                                                       & y are how many pixels were
                                                       trimmed off the left and right, and
                                                       height & width are the untrimmed
                                                       size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state.
                                            Properties on this parameter override data in
                                            the label parameter for this button state
                                            only. All values except "text" from the label
                                            parameter may be overridden.

props.name: down
props.description:
The visual information about the down state. If
                                      omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description:
The sourceRect for the state within the

springroll.pixi.AdvancedMovieClip.name: springroll.pixi.AdvancedMovieClip
springroll.pixi.AdvancedMovieClip.description:
A class similar to PIXI.extras.MovieClip, but made to play animations _exclusively_ using
the Animator, with data exported by the BitmapMovieClip exporter.

Format for AdvancedMovieClip data (the same as BitmapMovieClip):

	{
		fps:30,
		labels:
		{
			animStart:0,
			animStart_loop:15
		},
		origin:{ x: 20, y:30 },
		frames:
		[
			{
				name:"myAnim#",
				min:1,
				max:20,
				digits:4
			}
		],
		scale:1
	}

The example object describes a 30 fps animation that is 20 frames long, and was originally
myAnim0001.png->myAnim0020.png, with frame labels on the first and 16th frames. 'digits' is
optional, and defaults to 4.

params.name: data
params.description: Initialization data

props.name: fps
props.description:
Framerate to play the movieclip at. Omitting this will use the
                        current framerate.

props.name: labels
props.description:
A dictionary of the labels in the movieclip to assist in
                              playing animations.

props.name: origin
props.description: The origin of the movieclip.

props.name: frames
props.description: An array of frame sequences to pull from the texture atlas.

props.name: name
props.description:
The name to use for the frame sequence. This should
                                   include a "#" to be replaced with the image number.

props.name: min
props.description: The first frame number in the frame sequence.

props.name: max
props.description: The last frame number in the frame sequence.

props.name: digits
props.description:
The maximum number of digits in the names of the frames,
                                    e.g. myAnim0001 has 4 digits.

props.name: scale
props.description:
The scale at which the art was exported, e.g. a scale of 1.4
                               means the art was increased in size to 140% before exporting
                               and should be scaled back down before drawing to the screen.

params.name: atlas
params.description:
A TextureAtlas to pull frames from. If omitted,
                                              frames are pulled from Pixi's global texture
                                              cache.

springroll.pixi.Button.name: springroll.pixi.Button
springroll.pixi.Button.description:
A Multipurpose button class. It is designed to have one image, and an optional text label.
The button can be a normal button or a selectable button.
The button functions similarly with both EaselJS and PIXI, but slightly differently in
initialization and callbacks.
Use the "buttonPress" and "buttonOver" events to know about button clicks and mouse overs,
respectively.

params.name: imageSettings
params.description:
Information about the art to be used for button states, as
                              well as if the button is selectable or not.

props.name: up
props.description:
The texture for the up state of the button.
                                                This can be either the texture itself, or an
                                                object with 'tex' and 'label' properties.

props.name: tex
props.description:
The texture to use for the up state. If
                                                    this is a string, Texture.fromImage()
                                                    will be used.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state.
                                              Properties on this parameter override data in
                                              the label parameter for this button state
                                              only. All values except "text" and "type" from
                                              the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: over
props.description:
The texture for the over state of the
                                                       button. If omitted, uses the up
                                                       state.

props.name: tex
props.description:
The texture to use for the over state.
                                                      If this is a string,
                                                      Texture.fromImage() will be used.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state.
                                                Properties on this parameter override data
                                                in the label parameter for this button state
                                                only. All values except "text" and "type"
                                                from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: down
props.description:
The texture for the down state of the
                                                       button. If omitted, uses the up
                                                       state.

props.name: tex
props.description:
The texture to use for the down state.
                                                      If this is a string,
                                                      Texture.fromImage() will be used.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state.
                                                Properties on this parameter override data
                                                in the label parameter for this button state
                                                only. All values except "text" and "type"
                                                from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: disabled
props.description:
The texture for the disabled
                                                           state of the button. If omitted,
                                                           uses the up state.

props.name: tex
props.description:
The texture to use for the disabled
                                                          state. If this is a string,
                                                          Texture.fromImage() will be used.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this
                                                    state. Properties on this parameter
                                                    override data in the label parameter for
                                                    this button state only. All values
                                                    except "text" and "type" from the label
                                                    parameter may be overridden.

props.name: <yourCustomState>
props.description:
The visual information
                                                                    about a custom state
                                                                    found in
                                                                    imageSettings.priority.
                                                                    Any state added this way
                                                                    has a property of the
                                                                    same name added to the
                                                                    button. Examples of
                                                                    previous states that
                                                                    have been
                                                                    moved to this system are
                                                                    "selected" and
                                                                    "highlighted".

props.name: tex
props.description:
The texture to use for
                                                                   your custom state. If
                                                                   this is a string,
                                                                   Texture.fromImage()
                                                                   will be used.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to
                                                             this state. Properties on this
                                                             parameter override data in the
                                                             label parameter for this button
                                                             state only. All values except
                                                             "text" from the label parameter
                                                             may be overridden.

props.name: origin
props.description:
An optional offset for all button graphics,
                                                in case you want button positioning to not
                                                include a highlight glow, or any other
                                                reason you would want to offset the button
                                                art and label.

props.name: scale
props.description:
The scale to use for the textures. This allows
                                        smaller art assets than the designed size to be
                                        used.

params.name:
[imageSettings.priority=null] The state priority order. If omitted, defaults
                                             to ["disabled", "down", "over", "up"]. Previous
                                             versions of Button used a hard coded order:
                                             ["highlighted", "disabled", "down", "over",
                                             "selected", "up"]
label
params.description:
Information about the text label on the button. Omitting this
                             makes the button not use a label.

props.name: type
props.description:
If label.type is "bitmap", then a PIXI.extras.BitmapText text
                             is created, otherwise a PIXI.Text is created for the label.

props.name: text
props.description: The text to display on the label.

props.name: style
props.description:
The style of the text field, in the format that
                              PIXI.extras.BitmapText and PIXI.Text expect.

props.name: x
props.description:
An x position to place the label text at relative
                                          to the button.

props.name: y
props.description:
A y position to place the label text at relative
                                          to the button. If omitted, "center" is used, which
                                          attempts to vertically center the label on the
                                          button.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether or not the button is initially enabled.

classitems.description:
By default BitmapMovieClip instances advance one frame per tick. Specifying a framerate for
the BitmapMovieClip will cause it to advance based on elapsed time between ticks as
appropriate to maintain the target framerate.

For example, if a BitmapMovieClip with a framerate of 10 is placed on a Stage being updated
at 40fps, then the BitmapMovieClip will advance roughly one frame every 4 ticks. This will
not be exact, because the time between each tick will vary slightly between frames.

This feature is dependent on the tick event object (or an object with an appropriate "delta"
property) being passed into {{#crossLink "Stage/update"}}{{/crossLink}}.

seconds.

props.description:
The brightness adjustment for the disabled
                                              state. 100 is fully bright, 0 is unchanged,

props.name: alpha
props.description:
The alpha value for the glow, from 0 to 255,
                                              with 0 being transparent and 255 fully opaque.

props.description:
An array of values to use for red, green, blue, and

                                        providing separate properties on highlightSettings.

classitems.description:

called after you have loaded up javascript assets exported from Flash,
but before you have instantiated those assets.

The JSON object describing the frames in the atlas. This is

                                TexturePacker.

The spritesheet image that contains all of
                                                  the frames.

params.name: scale
params.description:
The scale to apply to all sprites from the spritesheet. For
                          example, a half sized spritesheet should have a scale of 2.

classitems.description:
Pulled from EaselJS's SpriteSheetUtils.
Merges the rgb channels of one image with the alpha channel of another. This can be used to
combine a compressed JPEG image containing color data with a PNG32 monochromatic image
containing alpha data. With certain types of images (those with detail that lend itself to
JPEG compression) this can provide significant file size savings versus a single RGBA PNG32.
This method is very fast (generally on the order of 1-2 ms to run).
classitems.name: mergeAlpha

params.name: rbgImage
params.description: The image (or canvas) containing the RGB channels to use.

params.name: alphaImage
params.description: The image (or canvas) containing the alpha channel to use.

params.name: canvas
params.description:
If specified, this canvas will be used and returned. If not, a new
                     canvas will be created.

return.description:
A canvas with the combined image data. This can be used as a source for a
             Texture.

classitems.description: Plays a sound.

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias of the sound to play.

params.name: options
params.description:
The object of optional parameters or complete
callback function.

props.name: complete
props.description: An optional function to call when the sound is finished.

props.name: start
props.description:
An optional function to call when the sound starts
playback. If the sound is loaded, this is called immediately, if not, it calls
when the sound is finished loading.

props.name: interrupt
props.description:
If the sound should interrupt previous
sounds (SoundJS parameter). Default is false.

props.name: delay
props.description:
The delay to play the sound at in milliseconds
(SoundJS parameter). Default is 0.

props.name: offset
props.description:
The offset into the sound to play in milliseconds
(SoundJS parameter). Default is 0.

props.name: loop
props.description:
How many times the sound should loop. Use -1
(or true) for infinite loops (SoundJS parameter). Default is no looping.

props.name: volume
props.description:
The volume to play the sound at (0 to 1).
Omit to use the default for the sound.

props.name: pan
props.description:
The panning to start the sound at (-1 to 1).
Default is centered (0).

return.description:
An internal SoundInstance object that can be used for
fading in/out as well as pausing and getting the sound's current position.
